name: Robert Moses
description: Planner and authority builder who reshaped New York's infrastructure.

name: City Hall
description: Mayors, agencies, and political appointees overseeing city governance.

name: New York State Parks
description: State-level commission controlling park funds and access.

name: Triborough Bridge & Tunnel Authority
description: Self-financing authority that consolidated revenue and control.

name: Long Island Parks
description: Regional park systems tied to parkway expansion.

name: Parks Department
description: Municipal department executing public works and maintenance.

name: WPA
description: Federal work program that financed pools and civic upgrades.

name: Federal Highway Bureau
description: Federal funding stream for expressway construction.

name: Housing Authority
description: Agency responsible for public housing and clearance sites.

name: City Press
description: Journalists and editors shaping public narrative.

name: Contractors
description: Construction firms benefiting from procurement pipelines.

name: Cultural Establishment
description: Foundations and patrons backing prestige projects.

name: Bronx Community Coalitions
description: Neighborhood leaders and clergy resisting displacement.
